revisionDesc.change: Finalized - ready
Vote - Accept-Straight-to-Finalization - Accept. This restores a comment to the change description.
Manual restoration of external editor comment (see added <change> element beginning "I sent W. Clarysse...")XML Markup Change
Finalized - ready

Vote - AcceptText - Ζ-R.'s reading of Ἁροββροοῦς is good. Τ̣ααο̣υ̣ς̣ is difficult to defend, since the first letter looks more like alpha or lambda. The name Τααους is adopted on the basis of the list of contracting parties at the top of the duplicate document, P.Mich. 5.298. There however Τααους is also difficult to read. It looks more like Ααους, which could perhaps also be read in PSI 8.913. I vote to accept only Ἁροββροοῦς.

Vote - AcceptText - See comments below. At the beginning of lin1 of PSI 8 913 the ed.pr. offered Δ̣α. It cannot be Tau alpha, I think. Lambda alpha is possible. I would offer Λ̣α.3 as mark up at the beginning of the line.

I sent W. Clarysse the proposed emendation and my voting comments, plus the observation that at P.Mich. V 298.ctr.1 [Τ]αα[οῦ]ς, which is used as the parallel to support the new reading at PSI VIII 913.1, is almost entirely illegible in the online image. He replied, "I completely agree. The identification of the two women appears certain, but the name is not legible. In P.Mich. V 298 I cannot read anything, in PSI VIII 913 the reading of the edit princeps lambda-alpha is preferable to that of the corrector. Feminine names beginning with La- are very rare of course, but Ta- does not seem possible to me."

Vote - DEFER - DEFER. I am sending this out to a Sr Editor (W. Clarysse). I cannot see a tau at the start of line 1. Unless I misread, this is clearly an alpha or lambda. Then, a character I cannot read. Then the top half of a vertical, which might be the left extent of an upsilon (as in line 3: τριστέγου). So, I cannot agree (without further persuasion) on Τ̣ααο̣υ̣ς̣. Moreover, the parallel for such, P.Mich. V 298, is almost almost entirely illegible (in the online image) in the place where that name has been read. I do see Ἁροββροους clearly enough. zellman-rohrer has also proposed an emendation at P.Mich. V 298, where [Τ]αα[οῦ]ς -- the parallel for the reading here -- is essentially illegible. Sending P.Mich V 198 to the same editor for review.

Vote - ReturnToSender - Please take a look at the following files in papyri.info: papyri.info/ddbdp/sb;22;15336; papyri.info/ddbdp/p.vind.sal;;7; papyri.info/ddbdp/p.oxy;8;112; papyri.info/ddbdp/sb;20;15020. If you click on the Editorial history and look at the submission notes it will indicate to you how we would like to enter these types of correction.
Vote - ReturnToSender - In the submission comments box please explain in some detail what has been changed and why.
line 1: Λα ̣ ̣[ ̣ ̣] ̣ ̣ο ̣βρεους → Τ̣ααο̣υ̣ς̣ Ἁροββροους based on digital image (psi-online.it), supported by the duplicate, P.Mich. V 298.1
proposed a correction in line 1: digital image available at psi-online.it; cf. the duplicate (P.Mich. V 298)
Finalized - Ready.
Vote - Accept-Straight-to-Finalization - Fine.
entered BL correction
rationalized languages in langUsage
changed editor names to URIs
Automatic insertion of lb tags into origs to match existing lb tags in the reg
Third automated transfer of accents across reg-orig pairs
changed type=inWord to break=no
Automatically updated revision description
Automated transfer of accents across reg-orig pairs
moved linebreak and missing characters into reg
batch converted all tei:sic to tei:orig and tei:corr to tei:reg
changed schema; added xml:space=preserve; indented; moved title/@n to idno
Added language la-Grek
Converted from TEI P4 (EpiDoc DTD v. 6) to P5 (EpiDoc RNG schema)
Automated split from transcoder files

div.ab:
Λα ἉροββροουςΛαοβρεους μετὰ κυρίου τοῦ ἀνδρὸς ΚρονίωνοςΚρονίων Παποντῶτος ὁμολογῶὁμολογῶι
πεπρακέναι Ποτάμωνι Ὀννόφρις τὸ ὑπάρχον μοι πατρικὸν πέμπτον μέρος
οἰκίας τριστέγου καὶ αὐλὴς πλὴν τοῦ ἐν τῇ οἰκίᾳ οἴκου ἑνός , ἐν ᾧ ἐστιν ταμεῖονταμῖον ἐπὶ
τοῦ πυλῶνος οἵ εἰσινἰσιν Παποντῶτος Μάρωνος καὶ ἐπὶ τοῦ ταμείουταμίου ἐπιπέδου ἐντὸς
τοῦ πυλῶνος ἐστὶν Ὀρσεῦς Βρύωνος, ἐπὶ δὲ τοῦ προκιμένου πέμπτου μέρο
υς πλὴναὐλὴν τούτων κοινῶν καὶ ἀδιαιρέτωνκαιδιερέτων πρὸς τὸν αὐτὸν ΠοτάμωναΠοταμωνι· ὧν γείτο
νεςγίτο
νος πάσης τῆς οἰκίας καὶ αὐλῆς νότου υἱῶνὑειῶν ΚρονίωνοςΚρωνίωνος Ασιαδις οἰκία καὶ αὐλή,
βορρᾶ Ὀρσενοῦφις ΒέλφιςΒέδφις οἰκίαοἰκίας καὶ αὐλήαὐλῆς, λιβὸς τοῦ προγεγραμμένου Κρον
ίωνος καὶ τῶν μετόχων οἰκία, ἀπηλιώτου ῥύμη βασιλικήβασιλικῆς· καὶ ἀπέχω παρὰ
τοῦ Ποτάμωνος τὴν συνκεχωρημένην τιμὴν πᾶσαν ἐκ πλήρους παρα χρῆ
μαπαρχρῆ
μα διὰ χειρὸς ἐξἐκς οἴκουὔκου καὶ βεβαιώσωβεβεώσω τὴν πρᾶσιν πάσῃ βεβαιώσειβεβεώσιν
ἀπὸ μὲν δημοσίων καὶ ἰδιωτικῶν καὶ πάσηςπάση ἐνποιήσεως ἐπὶ τὸν ἅπαντα χρόνο
ν καθὼς πρόκιται. ἔγραψεν ὑπὲρ αὐτῶν Ὀρσεῦς Ὀρσεῦτος διὰ τὸ μὴ εἰδέ
ναιεἰδέ
νε αὐτοὺς γράμματα.
